messages.message:
Hi, I am trying to cherry pick a commit onto an old release version. After resolving my conflicts and running `git cherry-pick --continue`  I am getting this error. Is anyone able to help with this? Thank you!
```instabase git:(cherrypick_prepost_flow_udf) ✗ git cherry-pick --continue
[INFO] Initializing environment for <git://github.com/dnephin/pre-commit-golang>.
An unexpected error has occurred: CalledProcessError: Command: ('/opt/homebrew/Cellar/git/2.37.2/libexec/git-core/git', 'clone', '--no-checkout', '<git://github.com/dnephin/pre-commit-golang>', '/Users/arjunnatarajan/.cache/pre-commit/repovyisdpix')
Return code: 128
Expected return code: 0
Output: (none)
Errors: 
    Cloning into '/Users/arjunnatarajan/.cache/pre-commit/repovyisdpix'...
    fatal: unable to connect to github.com (http://github.com):
    github.com[0 (http://github.com[0): 140.82.112.3]: errno=Operation timed out ```
How old of a release are we talking about? We may have changed the pre-commit hooks since then
If you’re certain that your cherry-pick is correct and doesn’t break anything, you could try to disable the pre-commit hooks (see SO answer (https://stackoverflow.com/a/67924079)).
Otherwise, you can use the github bot we have to create your cherry-pick PR with a `/trop` command that I need to pull up…
ah okay, unfortunately I don’t think `/trop` will work in this case since the ib-cp-bot already failed to automatically backport
ya i think for backporting, try skipping the pre-commit hook and run them manually. Basically just run eslint and typescript manually on the uncommited code. Then skip the pre-commit hook
